definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: Nowhere in Uzhhorod have I seen things like this.
sentences.chinese: 我从没在乌日戈罗德的其它地方见过这样的蛋糕。

sentences.english: Since Rick never saw a ghost, he doesn't believe that they exist.
sentences.chinese: 瑞克从没见过鬼，所以不相信他们的存在。

sentences.english: He lived for the day, not cumbered and mortified by his memory.
sentences.chinese: 他生活在现在，从没受过自己的回忆的羞辱和妨碍。

sentences.english: Although had been in Shengzhou for close to ten years now, I had never been to Beizhang Mountain and passing there.
sentences.chinese: 到剡县也有将近十年了，可从没去过或路过北璋山。

sentences.english: Do you employ risk reduction techniques without fail?
sentences.chinese: 你是否使用风险降低技巧并从没失手？

sentences.english: For these letters, Yan Shu never really seen.
sentences.chinese: 对于这些情书，颜姝从没正眼看过。

sentences.english: I've not met such one ignoramus.
sentences.chinese: 我从没见过这么无知的人。

sentences.english: Ziggy over there never even met his kid.
sentences.chinese: 那边的兹基甚至从没见过他的孩子。

sentences.english: Fanny had not felt so comfortable for days and days.
sentences.chinese: 范妮多少天来从没这样心情舒畅过。

sentences.english: Ann: It’s said about 8 million yuan. I have never heard that any car made in China has such a high market price.
sentences.chinese: 据说是八百万，我从没听过国产车有这样高的市价。
我从没感觉到这么自在过。

sentences.english: If you never meditate before, this is a wonderful opportunity to do it for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 如果你从没冥想过，这是你们尝试的好机会。

sentences.english: He has never expected a touch to be so mysteriously arousing.
sentences.chinese: 他从没料到一个触碰能这般神秘地激起内心的激情。

sentences.english: I've never met anyone so lily-livered.
sentences.chinese: 我从没见过这样胆小的人。

sentences.english: He got booed after his first audition but he did not give up.
sentences.chinese: 他被嘘了，尽管他以前从没被嘘过。

sentences.english: I never imagined a 74-year-old could tap into it so well.
sentences.chinese: 我从没想过一个74岁的老人也可以参与其中。

definition: many times/on more than one occasion
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
the first time/for the first time
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
